full_threads.body:
Great way to start the week team 🔥🔥🔥

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Fathom <no-reply@fathom.video>
Date: Mon, Apr 14, 2025 at 10:21 AM
Subject: Recap for "Wolfpack Projects Sync"
To: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>


Meeting Purpose Weekly sync on Wolfpack Projects to review progress, discuss challenges, and align on next steps across multiple client websites and internal processes. Key Takeaways - Monday support queue backlog: Consider prioritizing support tickets over project work on Monday mornings - Project status: 2 paused, 8 with client, 2 at risk, 3 in final checks, 2 on track, 3 new - Go-live strategy: Avoid Friday launches; schedule for Monday-Thursday only - Google Maps API issue for John DiGio: Urgent priority due to high costs (hundreds $/week) Topics Project Updates - Kaiser (paused): Awaiting frontend updates from external freelancer - Gift of Life (paused): No specific updates - Mayo sites (with client): Multiple sites in progress; Andy to send consolidated update to Bonnie - My Genome Australia (at risk): Cindy to follow up with client Cathy - MD NSW (at risk): No updates - Smart Reviews (final checks): Minor backlog items remaining (pillar pages, industry field) - Gecko (final checks): - Testimonials removed by client - Product images pending update (Cindy & Glen) - Dynamic single product page in progress - Target go-live: Tomorrow (Tuesday) - Joel to outline WooCommerce migration steps for fresh install - All Parks (on track): Top priority for the week; Glen continuing work on other pages - New projects: TrueLine, Viva Engage (templates in progress), LifeWorks (lower priority), Master Lock (moving to design with Jaime) Custom Work - John DiGio: Awaiting client feedback; Cindy to follow up - Google Maps API issue: Joel made changes to Google account; needs further discussion due to high costs Internal Processes - SOP documentation: Cindy working on documenting processes for scaling - Client admin accounts: Suggestion to add SOP for clients to provide admin accounts using Wolf IQ email to avoid 2FA issues - Task management: Need to refine and prioritize task list in ClickUp Customer Success Highlight - Positive review from Jennifer after Joel's quick support response to Stripe account issue - Team encouraged to document and amplify these "magic moments" of customer satisfaction Next Steps - Cindy: Follow up with My Genome Australia client - Joel: Outline WooCommerce migration steps for Gecko - Manuel: Verify GA scripts for Gecko - Glen: Continue work on All Parks pages - Andy: Clean up All Parks backlog in project management tool - Joel & Andy: Discuss John DiGio Google Maps API cost issue - Cindy: Refine ClickUp task list to show priority tasks for the week - All: Document and share customer "magic moments" when they occur
Internal Meeting
Wolfpack Projects Sync
April 14, 2025 • 17 mins • View Meeting or Ask Fathom
Action Items ✨
Follow up w/ Cathy re My Genome Australia proj feedback
Cindy Valderama
Collab w/ Glen on Gecko prod img updates
Cindy Valderama
Doc Gecko WooCommerce migr steps, share w/ Cindy
Joel Maligalig
Verify Gecko GA scripts, coord w/ Joel
Manuel Manceli
Cont work on All Parks other pages
Glen Tenorio
Clean All Parks proj backlog items
Cindy Valderama
Follow up John DiGio re custom work feedback
Cindy Valderama
Address Johnny GSI Google Maps key issue (high pri, cost)
Joel Maligalig
Filter PM tool tasks by "to do" status & assignee
Cindy Valderama
Review/trim task list, focus current week priorities
Cindy Valderama
Meeting Summary ✨
General Template Customize • Change Template

Meeting Purpose

Weekly sync on Wolfpack Projects to review progress, discuss challenges, and align on next steps across multiple client websites and internal processes.

Key Takeaways

  • Monday support queue backlog: Consider prioritizing support tickets over project work on Monday mornings

  • Project status: 2 paused, 8 with client, 2 at risk, 3 in final checks, 2 on track, 3 new

  • Go-live strategy: Avoid Friday launches; schedule for Monday-Thursday only

  • Google Maps API issue for John DiGio: Urgent priority due to high costs (hundreds $/week)

Topics

Project Updates

  • Kaiser (paused): Awaiting frontend updates from external freelancer

  • Gift of Life (paused): No specific updates

  • Mayo sites (with client): Multiple sites in progress; Andy to send consolidated update to Bonnie

  • My Genome Australia (at risk): Cindy to follow up with client Cathy

  • MD NSW (at risk): No updates

  • Smart Reviews (final checks): Minor backlog items remaining (pillar pages, industry field)

  • Gecko (final checks):

    • Testimonials removed by client

    • Product images pending update (Cindy & Glen)

    • Dynamic single product page in progress

    • Target go-live: Tomorrow (Tuesday)

    • Joel to outline WooCommerce migration steps for fresh install

  • All Parks (on track): Top priority for the week; Glen continuing work on other pages

  • New projects: TrueLine, Viva Engage (templates in progress), LifeWorks (lower priority), Master Lock (moving to design with Jaime)

Custom Work

  • John DiGio: Awaiting client feedback; Cindy to follow up

  • Google Maps API issue: Joel made changes to Google account; needs further discussion due to high costs

Internal Processes

  • SOP documentation: Cindy working on documenting processes for scaling

  • Client admin accounts: Suggestion to add SOP for clients to provide admin accounts using Wolf IQ email to avoid 2FA issues

  • Task management: Need to refine and prioritize task list in ClickUp

Customer Success Highlight

  • Positive review from Jennifer after Joel's quick support response to Stripe account issue

  • Team encouraged to document and amplify these "magic moments" of customer satisfaction

Next Steps

  • Cindy: Follow up with My Genome Australia client

  • Joel: Outline WooCommerce migration steps for Gecko

  • Manuel: Verify GA scripts for Gecko

  • Glen: Continue work on All Parks pages

  • Andy: Clean up All Parks backlog in project management tool

  • Joel & Andy: Discuss John DiGio Google Maps API cost issue

  • Cindy: Refine ClickUp task list to show priority tasks for the week

  • All: Document and share customer "magic moments" when they occur
